data.title: Largest U.S. Banks by Total Domestic Deposits in 2024
data.meta_description: A list of the 250 largest banks in the United States ranked by total domestic deposits according to data from the FDIC as of March 31, 2024.
data.text:
We found that it was harder than it should be to find a current list of the largest banks in the United States ranked by domestic deposits, so we made one. Below is the latest update based on March 31, 2024, data from the FDIC.

Top 10 American Banks by Total Deposits:

JPMorgan Chase ($2,061,107,000 total deposits)

Bank of America ($1,929,388,000 total deposits)

Wells Fargo Bank ($1,414,352,000 total deposits)

Citibank ($764,688,000 total deposits)

U.S. BankÂ ($532,825,419 total deposits)

PNC Bank ($431,863,200 total deposits)

Truist Bank ( $406,143,000 total deposits)

Capital One ($374,089,715 total deposits)

Goldman Sachs Bank ($363,106,000 total deposits)

TD Bank ($298,344,717 total deposits)

We have ranked the top 250 banks in the U.S. by total domestic deposits below. To view more data, check out these other lists of top banks and credit unions:

Biggest U.S. Banks by Asset Size

Biggest U.S. Credit Unions by Asset Size

How Many Banks are in the United States?

In March 31, 2024, the FDIC listed 4,577 banks in total in the U.S.Â

The average total domestic deposits across the top 250 banks listed is approximately $30.4 billion.Â

Median total depositives, by contrast, is $11.5 billion among the top 250 banks.Â

The average consumer has at least 5 to 7 financial accounts with different providers, making it nearly impossible for bank, credit union, and fintech leaders to measure primacy. MX helps companies do more with financial data that empowers consumers to reach their financial goals.

*Note: Data available as of March 31, 2024, and does not reflect recent market changes.Â

Please also note FDIC lists all data in thousands USD and should be read as follows: $2,000,000,000 = $2 trillion.
